Description: Fragment of blue glazed composition (faience) vessel, probably an Egyptian-style New Year flask; mould-made; ridge and scale-pattern on exterior wall; covered with a glaze that is now a light turquoise colour.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: This item is probably from the Amathus excavations of 1893-4. The number '23' written on the front of the object might connect it with Tomb 23, but Smith's notebook says explicitly that this burial was empty. The attribution to this tomb must be regarded as conjectural. Object kindly identified by Dr Virginia Webb (2013).
